communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Historical licensing data for all licensed child care providers (active and closed) that were open anytime from 1/1/19-present:
•	Provider name or ID
•	Provider address or geocode
•	Latest license issue date and expiration date 
•	First license issue date
•	Any additional provider data that your agency collects

If electronic records from before 1/1/19 are available, I’d be happy to collect them as well.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gabrielle Pepin

title: Resta and Smith 1963 USE OF ELECTRONIC DATA PROCESSING

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Resta and Smith 1963 USE OF ELECTRONIC DATA PROCESSING
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A research report titled, "THE USE OF ELECTRONIC DATA PROCESSING IN CORRECTIONS AND LAW ENFORCEMENT,"  Accession Number: AD0427165,  Report Date: 1963-12-18, Corporate Author: SYSTEM DEVELOPMENT CORP SANTA MONICA CA, Personal Authors: Paul Emil Resta and Charles Philip Smith. A citation for this report can be found here: https://apps.dtic.mil/sti/citations/AD0427165.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

RAS

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Resta and Smith 1963 USE OF ELECTRONIC DATA PROCESSING
communications.communication:
Good Morning



This is in response to your below request dated September 5, 2023, requesting 
information under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). Under Department of 
Defense rules implementing the FOIA, published at 32 CFR 286, your request was 
categorized as "other". We have assigned our internal number of DTIC FOIA 
2023-533. The document that you have requested, are approved for public 
release. We will begin the process of digitizing the document for you.  This 
process normally takes 2-3 weeks to process but we are experiencing technical 
issues with getting documents through our final processing.  We are currently 
working to resolve this issue.  Not sure of a timeframe as of yet.  Our 
document and IT personnel are working the issue and as soon as the problem is 
resolved we will get this document to you.  We apologize for the delay in 
processing.
Thanks



Mike Hamilton

files.title: ~WRD2274
files.source: Defense Technical Information Center, United States of America

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Deaths at BHCF
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1) Investigations and reports—as well as supplementary materials including but not limited to intra-agency communications, logs, interview transcripts and medical files—containing information about the following incarcerated individuals who died at Bedford Hills Correction Facility. 

2) Any complaints/grievances submitted to the SCOC that reference their name or DIN#. 

Danaroy Countryman or Dana Roy Countryman #09G0727, (date of death: 6/17/10)
Kimberly Burse #00G0638, (6/28/14)
Dawn Jones #14G0276, (6/14/16)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Molly Hagan
